title: Colombia, ELN rebels hail progress in second round of peace talks
description: ELN official says two sides took 'first steps' towards a temporary ceasefire as negotiations in Mexico City conclude.

title: As President Xi begins a third term, what’s next for China?
description: Xi starts his 11th year in the job as tensions are rising with the United States and European Union.

title: Italy launches rescue for hundreds of refugees on boats
description: About 1,300 people in danger off Calabria, where 73 recently drowned, sparking scrutiny of Italy's rescue operations.

title: Ukraine says Bakhmut battle grinding down Russia’s best units
description: Comments from presidential aide are the latest signal of a shift by Kyiv to continue the defence of the city.

title: US legislators approve COVID origins intel declassification
description: Unanimous House vote sends bill to declassify US intelligence info about COVID origins to US President Joe Biden.

title: After political violence, Peru reckons with economic fallout
description: Peru's economy re-opens after three months of violent protests, damage has been inflicted on mining, tourism, key areas.

title: Silicon Valley Bank seized by FDIC as depositors pull cash
description: The bank failed after depositors - mostly technology workers and venture capital-backed companies - created a run on it.

title: Bahrain revokes Human Rights Watch parliament conference visas
description: Move comes after HRW called for conference attendees to raise the issue of 'repression of human rights in Bahrain'.

title: Mali postpones constitutional referendum
description: The delay means the military will miss the first deadline on its own timetable to return the country to civilian rule.

title: Brazil’s Amazon deforestation again hits record high for February
description: Spike underscores challenge new President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva faces to reverse years of environmental destruction.

title: Timeline: Iran and Saudi Arabia, from rivalry to rapprochement
description: Iran and Saudi Arabia have had an adversarial history. Here's a look at recent important events in their relations.

title: Facebook parent Meta is exploring Twitter-like app
description: A Twitter-like app would allow Meta to take advantage of the current chaos at the Elon Musk-led company.

title: China rejects Canada ‘smears’ amid covert ‘police stations’ probe
description: Beijing says Ottawa harming its reputation as police investigate alleged Chinese-run 'police stations' in Quebec.

title: UK to fund France detention site as leaders agree migration deal
description: The UK will help fund a detention centre in France as part of a financial package to tackle irregular migration.

title: Iran, Saudi Arabia agree to resume ties: World reacts
description: A roundup of international reaction to the rapprochement between the two regional powers after seven years of tensions.

title: West still welcoming Ukrainian refugees, but challenges lie ahead
description: Two German hosts share their different experiences playing host, as analysts say support for Ukrainians remains steady.

title: US adds 311,000 jobs in February, unemployment at 3.6 percent
description: Unemployment rate raises slightly, Fed expected to continue interest rate hikes in light of strong jobs numbers.

title: Chile’s abortion rights movement faces uphill battle
description: Advocates say fight continues despite rejection of new constitution that would have enshrined reproductive rights.

title: Civilians pay heavy price of worsening conflict in east DRC: UN
description: Escalating violence forced 300,000 people to flee Rutshuru and Masisi territories of North Kivu province last month.

title: Prosecuting a few ‘bad guys’ will not heal Lebanon’s wounds
description: Delivering true justice to Beirut blast victims and preventing the repeat of such a tragedy requires systemic change.

title: Turkey to hold presidential, parliamentary elections on May 14
description: Elections are expected to be the Turkish opposition's best chance to unseat President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in 20 years.

title: Turmoil in Israel, trepidation in Palestine
description: As they work to unleash greater violence on the Palestinians, its rulers are turning Israel into a fascist garrison.

title: Iran and Saudi Arabia ‘agree to restore relations’
description: The regional rivals reportedly agreed to the restoration of ties after talks in Beijing.

title: Trump attorney: Lawyers ‘weaponising justice system’ against him
description: Ex-president is offered a chance to testify before a grand jury over alleged payment of hush money to porn star.

title: How Ukrainians are surviving winter during the war
description: Al Jazeera speaks to people in Ukraine who are enduring the cold without regular heat or electricity.

title: Georgia’s parliament drops controversial ‘foreign agents’ bill
description: Meanwhile, Moscow accuses the US of stoking anti-Russian sentiment among the thousands who protested against the bill.

title: Key issues and players: Xi’s next 5 years as China’s president
description: China's Xi Jinping faces severe economic challenges and growing tension with the United States as his third term begins.

title: Australia, India pledge to strengthen economic and security ties
description: Anthony Albanese and Narendra Modi agree to bolster bilateral ties during the Australian PM's visit to India.

title: French plans for AI surveillance during Olympics are dangerous
description: Proposed legislation to expand surveillance powers risks transforming the Olympics into an assault on privacy.

title: Imprisoned American in Iran calls on Biden to secure release
description: Siamak Namazi has urged US President Biden to secure his release and that of two other Americans.

title: NASA says asteroid has small chance of hitting Earth in 2046
description: Space rock with an average diameter of 49 metres is expected to have 10 approaches to Earth, the closest in 2046.

title: Israeli settler kills Palestinian in occupied West Bank
description: Israeli military says Palestinian was armed, but the man's family don't believe he was affiliated with armed groups.

title: What are the hypersonic missiles Russia is using in Ukraine?
description: Russia bombarded Ukraine on Thursday with Kinzhal missiles, which fly many times faster than the speed of sound.

title: Germany: 8 killed in mass shooting at Jehovah’s Witnesses centre
description: Gunman believed to be among the dead at the scene of the attack in Hamburg with an unknown number of wounded.

title: In Istanbul, earthquake survivors rebuild shattered lives
description: At least three million people have been displaced following the earthquakes that hit Turkey and Syria last month.

title: Can Toronto help Canada end casteism in the classroom?
description: The city's school board has become the first to recognise caste discrimination. All of Canada must follow.

title: Micronesia leader accuses China of bribery, threats in Taiwan bid
description: David Panuelo says Beijing conducting 'political warfare' against his island nation as part of campaign to take Taiwan.

title: Ex-Goldman banker Ng sentenced to 10 years over 1MDB scandal
description: Ng was last year found guilty of helping his former boss Tim Leissner embezzle money from the sovereign wealth fund.

title: Mexico cartel apologises for kidnapping Americans, returns bodies
description: The cartel handed over five of its members suspected to be behind the abduction to authorities.

title: Lack of cross-border flood alerts adds to disaster fears in Nepal
description: Amid threat of glacial lake floods, analysts rue a lack of information sharing among China, India and Nepal.

title: Hyundai reviewing Russia plant after reports of Kazakhstan sale
description: South Korean automaker says it is considering 'various options' for Saint Petersburg factory.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 380
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 380th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: China’s parliament backs Xi Jinping for third term as president
description: Xi has sidelined potential challengers and filled the party's top ranks with his supporters since taking power in 2012.

title: US sanctions 39 entities over alleged ‘shadow banking’ for Iran
description: US Treasury Department says 39 entities granted Iran access to the international financial system.

title: Malaysia’s ex-PM Muhyiddin Yassin charged with corruption
description: Former leader faces trial on charges of money laundering and abuse of power over COVID-19 contracts.

title: Michelle Yeoh’s success masks struggle of Malaysian film industry
description: Amid ethnic divisions, brain drain and censorship, Southeast Asian nation lags behind neighbours in cinematic success.

title: Malaysian ex-PM’s arrest puts focus on Anwar’s corruption fight
description: Former leader Muhyiddin Yassin has denied wrongdoing and described charges against him as a political witch hunt.

title: Judge extends pretrial detention for Peru’s ex-President Castillo
description: The former president will now serve 36 months as he awaits trial on charges including rebellion and organised crime.

title: Kim Jong Un calls for intensified drills to simulate ‘real war’
description: North Korean leader makes call just days before US and South Korea are due to start their largest drills since 2018.

title: Major Canadian school board recognises caste-based discrimination
description: Toronto's school board, the largest in Canada, joins a push to ban discrimination based on caste in North America.
